value.ai_summary:
Technical Summary:

The SolidSample repository is an educational project designed to demonstrate the SOLID principles of object-oriented design for C# developers, specifically as a companion resource for a Pluralsight course. It provides a progressive code example that illustrates how to refactor and improve software design by applying Single Responsibility (SRP), Open-Closed (OCP), Liskov Substitution (LSP), Interface Segregation (ISP), and Dependency Inversion (DIP) principles. The project is structured with multiple tagged branches corresponding to different stages of implementing these principles, making it a valuable learning resource for developers seeking to understand best practices in software architecture and design. Primarily targeting .NET developers and software engineering students, the repository uses Visual Studio 2019 and demonstrates practical techniques for creating more maintainable, extensible, and robust C# applications. What makes this repository unique is its step-by-step approach to teaching SOLID principles through a hands-on, code-based tutorial, created by Steve Smith (Ardalis), a well-known software design expert and Microsoft MVP.
